First, call the PUT method with the query sequence:

This will return a RID (request ID) that we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, call the GET method with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=<RID>]

Replace `<RID>` with the actual RID returned by the PUT method.

The response will contain the alignment results, including the chromosome location of the matched sequence.

To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, call the PUT method with the query sequence:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=GGACAGCTGAGATCACATCAAGGATTCCAGAAAGAATTGGCACAGGATCATTCAAGATGCATCTCTCCGTTGCCCCTGTTCCTGGCTTTCCTTCAACTTCCTCAAAGGGGACATCATTTCGGAGTTTGGCTTCCA&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

This will return a RID (request ID) that we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, call the GET method with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=]

Replace `` with the actual RID returned by the PUT method.

The response will contain the alignment results, including the chromosome location of the matched sequence.->[G487FE59016]
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=G487FE59016]

Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, call the PUT method with the query sequence:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=GGACAGCTGAGATCACATCAAGGATTCCAGAAAGAATTGGCACAGGATCATTCAAGATGCATCTCTCCGTTGCCCCTGTTCCTGGCTTTCCTTCAACTTCCTCAAAGGGGACATCATTTCGGAGTTTGGCTTCCA&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

This will return a RID (request ID) that we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, call the GET method with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=]

Replace `` with the actual RID returned by the PUT method.

The response will contain the alignment results, including the chromosome location of the matched sequence.->[G487FE59016]

Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Question: Align the DNA sequence to the human genome:AGGCCCTCACCTGGAAATTACTTACTCATGCTTCATGACCCAGTTCAAATTTTGTCACCTCTGTGAAACCTTCCCTGGGCCCCGTTGATCTCCTTGAAGGCA

To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, send a PUT request with the query sequence and other parameters:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=AGGCCCTCACCTGGAAATTACTTACTCATGCTTCATGACCCAGTTCAAATTTTGTCACCTCTGTGAAACCTTCCCTGGGCCCCGTTGATCTCCTTGAAGGCA&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

This will return a RID (Request ID) which we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, send a GET request with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=<RID>]

Replace `<RID>` with the actual RID returned by the PUT request.

The response will contain the alignment results, including the chromosome location and other information.

Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Question: Align the DNA sequence to the human genome:ATTAAACGCCCCTTAAATTACCCAGCTGTGGCAATCTGCTTCCTTGTGATACCCTGACTGATACGAATTATAAAGTAAATCCTGTGATACTCCCCCTCACCTCAAGCCCATGTTCCTGTAAGGTACAGAGTCATAGA

To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, send a PUT request with the query sequence and other parameters:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=ATTAAACGCCCCTTAAATTACCCAGCTGTGGCAATCTGCTTCCTTGTGATACCCTGACTGATACGAATTATAAAGTAAATCCTGTGATACTCCCCCTCACCTCAAGCCCATGTTCCTGTAAGGTACAGAGTCATAGA&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

This will return a RID (request ID) which we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, send a GET request with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=<RID>]

Replace `<RID>` with the actual RID returned by the PUT request. 

The result will be an alignment of the query sequence to the human genome, including information about the chromosome location and other relevant details.

Note: The actual output may vary depending on the specific DNA sequence and the current state of the BLAST database.

Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, send a PUT request with the query sequence and other parameters:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=ATTAAACGCCCCTTAAATTACCCAGCTGTGGCAATCTGCTTCCTTGTGATACCCTGACTGATACGAATTATAAAGTAAATCCTGTGATACTCCCCCTCACCTCAAGCCCATGTTCCTGTAAGGTACAGAGTCATAGA&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

Question: Align the DNA sequence to the human genome:CCTTAGCTTTGTCATATTAGAGGGCTGGGAGGGCCTGATCCCCTGGAACCTGCCTTTCCAACCTGATTTCCCATACTTCTTCCCATAAGCCAGATCCCATGATTTCTCTCATTTCTCCAAACAGGCCTCTTGATTTTCCACCTTGGAACT

To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, send a PUT request with the query sequence and other parameters:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=CCTTAGCTTTGTCATATTAGAGGGCTGGGAGGGCCTGATCCCCTGGAACCTGCCTTTCCAACCTGATTTCCCATACTTCTTCCCATAAGCCAGATCCCATGATTTCTCTCATTTCTCCAAACAGGCCTCTTGATTTTCCACCTTGGAACT&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

This will return a RID (Request ID) which we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, send a GET request with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=<RID>]

Replace `<RID>` with the actual RID returned by the PUT request.

The response will contain the alignment results, including the chromosome location and other information.

Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, send a PUT request with the query sequence and other parameters:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=CTTCATACAAAACGAAGAGTTAAGACCTACCGGTTTTCCAAAGCCTCCCTATGAAAAACAGTATTTCTCTTAGTGGCAGGTTTGAGGTATGAGAGTCATTATTACACCTGTGAGCTGGCC&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

This will return a RID (Request ID) which we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, send a GET request with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=<RID>]

Replace `<RID>` with the actual RID returned by the PUT request.

The response will contain the alignment results, including the chromosome location and other information.

Question: Align the DNA sequence to the human genome:CTTCATACAAAACGAAGAGTTAAGACCTACCGGTTTTCCAAAGCCTCCCTATGAAAAACAGTATTTCTCTTAGTGGCAGGTTTGAGGTATGAGAGTCATTATTACACCTGTGAGCTGGCC
To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, send a PUT request with the query sequence and other parameters:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=CTTCATACAAAACGAAGAGTTAAGACCTACCGGTTTTCCAAAGCCTCCCTATGAAAAACAGTATTTCTCTTAGTGGCAGGTTTGAGGTATGAGAGTCATTATTACACCTGTGAGCTGGCC&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

This will return a RID (Request ID) which we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, send a GET request with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=]

Replace `` with the actual RID returned by the PUT request.

The response will contain the alignment results, including the chromosome location and other information.->[G4BW7XWV016]
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=G4BW7XWV016]

Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different species. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Question: Align the DNA sequence to the human genome:AACATTAACTTATTTTACCCTCATGATACTTCATTGGGGTAAGTAATGTTAATATTCCTAATTGAAAGATGAGAAACTGGAAGATCAGAAGACTAAGTAATTTTTCCAAGA
To align the DNA sequence to the human genome, we need to use the BLAST API. Here's how you can do it:

First, send a PUT request with the query sequence and other parameters:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Put&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE=XML&QUERY=AACATTAACTTATTTTACCCTCATGATACTTCATTGGGGTAAGTAATGTTAATATTCCTAATTGAAAGATGAGAAACTGGAAGATCAGAAGACTAAGTAATTTTTCCAAGA&HITLIST_SIZE=5]

This will return a RID (Request ID) which we can use to retrieve the results.

Next, send a GET request with the RID:
[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD=Get&FORMAT_TYPE=Text&RID=]

Replace `` with the actual RID returned by the PUT request.

The response will contain the alignment results, including the chromosome location and other information.->[G4DRE137016]
